etymology.description: pictogram: a vertical eye looking downward; the 'eye' sense appears when used as a component (e.g., 臨, 監).
etymology.interpretation: A downward-looking eye evokes subordination or being overseen, which broadened to meanings like servant, subject, and minister. As a component it retains the sense of viewing or overseeing, especially of looking down from above.

examples.chinese: 皇帝召见群臣(皇帝召見群臣)。
他被任命为财政大臣(他被任命為財政大臣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi rènmìng wéi cáizhèng dàchén.

examples.chinese: 在古代，臣子必须对君主尽忠(在古代，臣子必須對君主盡忠)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔdài, chénzǐ bìxū duì jūnzhǔ jìn zhōng.
examples.english: In ancient times, subjects had to be loyal to their ruler.
